programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth thinks Les is stuck in the past for hand-delivering their gold to a refinery, and bets his father that his new mail order service will improve things.

programme.title: Texas Rising
programme.desc: The Texas Rangers rescue Emily, but suffer a tragic loss in doing so, Drama set during the Texas Revolution.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle go treasure hunting in Virginia, in search of bargains to stock their new shop.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a crumbling building full of salvaged gems, but have a hard time getting the valuables out safely before the roof caves in.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Owner operator Justin Harrison is on an epic haul up through the red heart of Australia.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband and wife trucking team Nick and Jo Atkins are about to embark on a dangerous trek north through one of the worldâ€™s last wilderness frontiers..

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team turns a petrol pump into a beer cooler and restore a sign from a 1970s fast food restaurant.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Singer Jason Mraz asks Rick to help him restore a sign as a tribute to his late grandfather.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The crew restores an ejector seat from a 1950s jet fighter, while Brettly works on a popcorn machine.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick challenges a new painter to prove his skills in a contest with Countign Cars' Horney Mike, and a client brings in a 1970s wet bike.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: An analysis of ancient monuments, questioning what compelled man to move colossal stones long distances to assemble remarkably similar configurations in several locations around the world. Some people believe that extraterrestrials instructed these complex structures be built. Presented by Giorgio Tsoukalos.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about UFOs, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1 that suggest cover-ups and conspiracy theories have concealed the truth for decades. As well as delving into cases where UFOs have chased commercial flights, the series tries to understand what the US government might be hiding from its people.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions between Karen and Ashley explode on the sales floor, so Les puts them both in the doghouse. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les goes on a buying spree that leaves his staff wondering what is going on. Meanwhile, Karen needs Byron's help to handle a pair of unruly piano players.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A model train, allegedly owned by Johnny Cash rolls into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether it is worth adding to Rick's collection.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A piece of the 1990s rolls into the shop as the guys check out 'The Mirthmobile' from Wayne's World.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go back to Montebello, where some of their biggest finds and greatest dramas have occurred.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hope for hidden treasures at auctions in Moreno Valley, as Dave attempts to make his mark on new territory, while Mary tries out a risky new idea.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Behind the scenes as Ton and Allen show how to profile a room and be the best Auction Hunter you can be.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: Blow Out.

programme.title: Hangar 1: The UFO Files
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the truth about captured aliens, examining evidence from some of the 70,000 case files hidden away in an Ohio warehouse called Hangar 1.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The fearsome and mysterious gods worshipped by the Norse Vikings, considering whether the super-beings that guided the Vikings were actually visitors from another planet.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick checks out a 1939 Superman doll, while Corey has a jam on a 1952 Fender Telecaster.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A rare Rolling Stones record spins into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether it meets Rick's satisfaction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The teams make a long trip to auctions in Palm Desert, and Mary plays a risky game when she bids way beyond her budget.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi hope for more good luck as the buyers return to San Diego, while Ivy comes across a cross-dressing locker.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys are keen to win a climate-controlled unit stuffed with contemporary art, but they have some competition. Plus, Clinton has a hunch about a quad bike.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones take a tactical approach to secure a big result at a storage auction, after spotting fishing tackle, a boat motor and instruments in a pair of units.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: After a challenging preliminary, the two finalists must re-create one of the Ottoman Empire's most lethal sabres - the Kilij.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: Bespectacled and coiffed blacksmith Alec Steele hits the forge to craft the Bowie knife, a legendary fighting blade.

programme.title: Forged with Steele
programme.desc: Blacksmith Alec Steele challenges himself to create a Viking seaux in his Norwich forge. This heavy knife was wielded by Norse raiders and warriors.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers go back to Montebello, where some of their biggest finds and greatest dramas have occurred.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hope for hidden treasures at auctions in Moreno Valley, as Dave attempts to make his mark on new territory, while Mary tries out a risky new idea.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian tests his preconceptions of Albania, guided on a whistlestop tour of the country by local TV presenter and journalist Erjona Rusi. Along the way, he tries to discover why Albania has remained a stubbornly unfashionable holiday destination, meeting those at the extremes of the country, from the rural farmers to the billionaire playboys who live in the cities in the company of supermodels.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Micky Flanagan, Nathan Caton and Stewart Francis join Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a 2011 edition of the comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites actor Ross Kemp, singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor and comedian Rob Beckett to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares to the depths of Room 101 for ever. Their gripes include misplaced clapping, teeth, expensive water in hotel rooms and snobby shop assistants.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Kaiser Chiefs' frontman Ricky Wilson, and comedians Joe Lycett and Zoe Lyons to express their anger over people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include new towels, escalators and the bartender at the local pub.

programme.title: Jon Richardson: Ultimate Worrier
programme.desc: Jon is joined by Romesh Ranganthan and Kerry Godliman to address worries to do with travel, including whether space is too untidy or the effect of driverless cars on parking skills.

programme.title: The Misadventures of Romesh Ranganathan
programme.desc: The comedian tests his preconceptions of Albania, guided on a whistlestop tour of the country by local TV presenter and journalist Erjona Rusi. Along the way, he tries to discover why Albania has remained a stubbornly unfashionable holiday destination, meeting those at the extremes of the country, from the rural farmers to the billionaire playboys who live in the cities in the company of supermodels.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: Comedian Nick Helm embarks on a tongue-in-cheek international culinary pilgrimage, beginning on home turf in Islington, as he shares a 'cowboy chop' with Bob Mortimer.

programme.title: Eat Your Heart Out with Nick Helm
programme.desc: The comedian samples the culinary delights of Camden, as he goes for a smokehouse breakfast with an old friend, and takes vegan Morgana Robinson to an Argentinian steakhouse.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys pick the collection of a reclusive and mysterious businessman named The Colonel, who has gone to great lengths to keep his identity a secret.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders are looking for treasure in Somerset's storage units, where a bouncy castle and an air boat are among the finds.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Heavy D is in town and is prepared to risk having his fingers burned for the chance of a big score, while auctioneer Sean Kelly keeps a watchful eye.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a jaw-dropping Kentucky property with a racetrack that revives an old Mike and Frank rivalry. Later, a freestyle stop in North Carolina looks like a bust.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In an antique shop closed since the 1970s, Mike and Frank go toe-to-toe with the sibling owners who negotiate for every last dollar.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Bryan Jr builds an outdoor kitchen before hitting the beach in search of the ultimate driftwood bar.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters try to impress Oxford residents by building an electric car, and refuse to let an unenthusiastic response deter them from sitting in on the machine's crash-test before handing it over to the Stig's environmentally friendly cousin. Actor Michael Sheen is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and Jeremy Clarkson pits the Corvette ZR1 against the Audi R8 V10

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: More than 100 boxes full of drugs are discovered inside an unlikely vehicle at the World Trade Bridge. In Progreso, a suspected gang member attempts to cross into the United States.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond debate which company has made the greatest number of exceptional vehicles, and James May finds a way of transporting caravans to campsites without inconveniencing other road users. The Top Gear track plays host to a replica of one of the world's most famous rally cars, and broadcaster Chris Evans - some five years before he was announced as the show's new presenter - is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson puts the Renaultsport Twingo 133 through a stringent examination in Belfast - with a helping hand from actor Ross Kemp. Richard Hammond samples the delights of racing airport vehicles, and James May takes the Vauxhall Insignia VXR for a drive in the company of Margaret Calvert, whose ideas were central to the design of modern British road signs. Film director Guy Ritchie is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car, and there is also a group test of high-performance off-roaders from BMW, Audi and Range Rover.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: At the halfway stage, all contestants - except Phil Wang - are in with a chance of victory. Kerry Godliman and Jessica Knappett resort to soapy violence.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites actor Ross Kemp, singer Sophie Ellis-Bextor and comedian Rob Beckett to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares to the depths of Room 101 for ever. Their gripes include misplaced clapping, teeth, expensive water in hotel rooms and snobby shop assistants.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Kaiser Chiefs' frontman Ricky Wilson, and comedians Joe Lycett and Zoe Lyons to express their anger over people and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include new towels, escalators and the bartender at the local pub.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Doc Martin star Martin Clunes takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Jon Richardson and Newsnight presenter Kirsty Wark joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Host Stephen Fry poses tough questions about Happiness to Andy Hamilton, Rich Hall, Phill Jupitus and Alan Davies, and awards points for the answers he deems most interesting.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedians Lucy Porter and Romesh Ranganathan and TV judge Robert Rinder to express their anger over people, events and objects that upset them, as the trio vie to banish their top peeves, annoyances, irritation or worst nightmares consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include lavish proposals, school reunions and New Year's Eve.

programme.title: Meet the Richardsons
programme.desc: Comedy series starring real-life married couple Jon Richardson and Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together. Jon is given career advice from his comedy hero, Jack Dee. Meanwhile, Lucy signs Jon up to be the celebrity judge at the World Dock Pudding Competition in Hebden Bridge.

credits.actor: Lucy Beaumont as they offer a fictional view of their life together

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Guests Miles Jupp, Ava Vidal and Carl Donnelly join Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for a 2011 edition of the topical comedy quiz show. Dara O Briain hosts.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: Documentary following the engineers and aviators who battle to keep the UK's most historic warplanes in the air. In the first edition, the team rebuild a Spitfire MJ772.

programme.title: Waterloo Dead
programme.desc: Two hundred years after the Battle of Waterloo, investigators Tim Sutherland, Malin Holst and Simon Richardson employ forensic techniques to uncover surprising secrets from one of the greatest military encounters of all time.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Questions regarding the authenticity of the Jehoash Tablet, a religious artifact containing an ancient inscription.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Secrets of the Bible
programme.desc: Egyptologist David Rohl searches for the location of the Tower of Babel, a Biblical structure which first appeared in the Book of Genesis.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: Kiruna to Narvik - Hitler's Arctic Railway Line
programme.desc: The Nordland Line, the longest in Norway at 453 miles. Stretching between Trondheim and Bodo, it was first built to transport the country's greatest natural resource - iron ore.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Secrets of the Murder Bureau
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates a secret department of the Bulgarian government charged with carrying out assassinations in nine other countries during the Cold War.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: How Hitler used recreation to promote his ideology, setting up the world's largest beach resort and travel agency and attempting to turn the Olympics into a propaganda tool.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at the sinister history of Edinburgh's vaults and the development of Helsinki's subterranean spaces. Plus, the impact of the building of Naples on the volcanic ground below.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: A look at the planet's most incredible metropolitan railways, and how they help people solve distinctly urban problems. Including a project to upgrade New York's transit system..

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of Her Majesty's Secret Service
programme.desc: The documentary series exploring the less well known side of Britain continues, with this edition exploring MI6, asking whether the shadowy world of espionage and counter-intelligence operations bear any resemblance to the James Bond novels.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: A look at the sinister history of Edinburgh's vaults and the development of Helsinki's subterranean spaces. Plus, the impact of the building of Naples on the volcanic ground below.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Engineering breakthroughs that allow trains to go faster than ever, including technology that allows the navigation of the winding mountains of Spain at speed..

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: A secret weapons program in the heart of Austria that could have ended badly for the Allies - and may have indicated nuclear plans being concocted by Hitler.

programme.title: Nazi Victory: The Post-War Plan
programme.desc: The documentary concludes with an insight into Hitler's plans to modernise the German transport system, including super trains and futuristic airports.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: Exploring the military headquarters built beneath Dover Castle during the Second World War and Odessa's catacombs, possibly the largest tunnel network in the world.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The historical importance of freight trains, including four-mile long vehicles transporting enough iron ore to build two Eiffel towers.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, including Tearful Party Guest and Public Service Announcement About Water Shortage.

programme.title: The Two Ronnies
programme.desc: Vintage comedy from Messrs Barker and Corbett, with music by Clodagh Rodgers.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The RMP begins a desperate search, as Tilbrook takes Markham to visit a very important prisoner and Ed receives intelligence that puts his life in danger. Alison confides in Honor about her affair as she finds herself unable to continue with her pregnancy.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The squad reinvestigates the death of a timeshare magnate, previously thought to have committed suicide, when a reformed call girl claims she was with him the night he died and saw someone force their way into his house as she left. It then emerges the deceased's widow has since fallen on hard times after being swindled by her late husband's business partner - who is connected to a notorious criminal. Guest starring Shane Richie, Naomi Bentley and Claire Rushbrook.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Emotions run high as the regiment is sent on a dangerous assignment to Bosnia, and Phillip's handling of a sensitive situation jeopardises his relationship with Captain Williams.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men return from Bosnia only to discover that they are now heading to Cyprus, and Sergeant Tony Wilton puts his life on the line training for the SAS.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Gina continues to keep the news of her cancer a closely guarded secret, little suspecting Amber has put two and two together after spotting her at the hospital. Gabriel rescues schoolgirl Gemma Bentley from the clutches of her wicked stepmother and is rewarded with a passionate kiss from Sheelagh, while Steve confronts Scott about the investigation into his wife's murder - and is given an ominous warning.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: On the day of Frank's funeral, Tricia is haunted by her role in his death and when an incident erupts at the service Mark is left furious, claiming that his father was right not to trust her. Connie's future hangs in the balance when her efforts to cover up the cause of death are exposed, Jess struggles to balance her career and motherhood, and a consultant from another hospital makes a tempting offer to Mubbs.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A woman facing eviction takes an overdose and George has bad news for a mother. Sean makes a severe error of judgement while treating a drunk teenager and Max's son lands himself in serious trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Gina warns Amber not to tell a soul about her cancer, but any hopes of keeping her illness secret are dashed when she's prescribed a course of daily radiotherapy. Scott reacts badly to the news that Greg's murder charges have been dropped, and Lance's latest assignment on the Cole Lane Estate proves something of a damp squib. Gabriel gives Sheelagh the brush-off, while Reg isn't quite sure what to make of Sun Hill's eager new receptionist Julian Tavell, known as JT.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie makes a bold move, Cindy makes a decision about her future, and Ricky helps his father cope with a shock..

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tricky Dicky takes on Ian, Pete sees a face from the past and Steve gives Hattie an answer.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team rushes to the scene of a bomb explosion at a hotel but, while sifting through the wreckage, Colin is nearly killed. Starring Steve North.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Molly is forced to do a bit of quick thinking when she falls foul of a Glasgow gangster keen to cash in on her gambling addiction. Light-hearted drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim races against time to prevent a ruthless blackmailer threatening to release a deadly batch of stolen nerve gas if his financial demands aren't met. Drama, starring John Nettles and Greg Hicks.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Adrian accidentally becomes a hero, Billy is troubled by his impending divorce, Aveline is preoccupied with pregnancy, and Joey is in real trouble.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Barry and Yvonne tread the light fantastic, and Spike has a humorous conversation with Pinocchio, while Ted attempts to foil Joe Maplin's expansion plans. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean models a party for the residents of an old people's home after the example set by Lionel's visiting father - but he is not the paragon of old age he pretends to be. Bittersweet comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Lenny turns up in the village once more, followed by his long-suffering assistant Cliff. This time, the show-business hopeful becomes convinced that he can finally make a name for himself by becoming an escapologist. Guest starring Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The death of a retired detective on his favourite golf course looks like a copycat murder. Dalziel points the finger of suspicion at local villain Danny Macer - but his relentless pursuit of his old adversary only serves to get him thrown off the case. Feature-length episode, directed by and starring Warren Clarke, with guest appearances from John Duttine, Pippa Guard and Diana Quick.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Sandra loses her trust in the others when she discovers they have withheld information concerning her father. The revelation he committed suicide while under investigation for corruption causes her to doubt everything she took for granted, but she tries to set her feelings aside when asked to look into the death of a circus ringmaster.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Thirteen years after the kidnap and murder of a teenage girl, Boyd finds a crucial piece of evidence and arrests the owner - reclusive hippie Alec Garvey. As the pressure for a conviction mounts from the Met Commissioner and the media, Boyd charges his man - but after the suspect resorts to desperate measures, the detective begins to realise the case is much more complicated than he imagined. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Steve, Virinder, Julie and Pat pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Feeling the full force of DI Renton's investigation, Laura looks to those closest to her for support, but when suspicions fall on Ian, she is left questioning who she can trust. Seeking answers, she turns to a former ally, but the information she gleans only fuels her concerns. Meanwhile in the past, Oliver brings Andrew some devastating news, leading him to make a reckless and dangerous excursion. programme.title: Hunting Hitler
programme.desc: In the Southern Andes, the team uncovers the town of Bariloche and the Inalco House, where Hitler could have stayed. Using network and financial analysis the team descends on Hotel Eden, a compound owned by two known and documented Nazi supporters, where an eyewitness claims to have seen Hitler, months after his supposed death.

programme.title: Treasure Quest: Snake Island
programme.desc: The team tracks down a unique marker, taking them to a maze-like location riddled with caves. The determination pays off as they start unearthing priceless artefacts.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Sully and Broomey race to move two 38-ton excavators from Bristol to Aldermaston in Berkshire, but mechanical problems threaten to stop them in their tracks.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The Orange County team throws open the doors to the company's new world headquarters, and christens the building with a design for a penguin-themed bike.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dan faces a huge project fixing a '47 Mack Firetruck - taking the team into wet territory. Plus, a '71 Malibu Chevelle that has not run in five years comes in.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Dave has his dream '57 Corvette, but his plans to build it have come to nothing. Meanwhile, Ken has picked a 1954 Kaiser Darrin from his father's collection.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look the manufacturing processes involved in making rolling luggage, croissants and u-locks.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how prams, wood flutes, bicycle tyres and factory-built homes are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the sitar, a classic Indian instrument, is crafted, how beef biltong is made, and how large bulldozers are built.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Some of Mike and Frank's finest finds and most premium picks in this series showcasing the best of their adventures.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: Life aboard ship in the Alaskan crab-fishing fleet, following the successes and failures of crewmen as they risk harsh conditions and fierce competition in the course of their work catching the valuable crustaceans.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Tempers flare halfway through the summer season, with Shawn threatening to quit the family business and the captains questioning their crews' loyalties.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Husband and wife Nick and Jo risk one last supply to a remote settlement as the wet season looms. Meanwhile, Craig and his son deliver hay to drought-hit stations.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer logs on to an online auction searching for a cheap Suzuki in need of repair. He soon finds an SJ410 and hands the vehicle over to mechanic Edd China for restoration.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. The work on the Suzuki continues as Edd China gives it a new interior, paint job and roll cage, aiming to make a tidy profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini enters a dusty Saab into the Barn Find competition and takes a vintage electric car for a spin.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini helps a man to build a car collection after restoring his Ferrari Lusso.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Some of Mike and Frank's finest finds and most premium picks in this series showcasing the best of their adventures.

programme.title: Railroad Alaska
programme.desc: Jim and Nancy journey to an abandoned cabin and discover that a bear has taken up residence, while Cathy and Larry go in search of an emergency vehicle.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crews race to catch the remainder of their quotas, Scottie Hillstrand makes a dangerous mistake and a radio message brings ominous tidings as the fleet heads for port.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The Pomrenkes hit pay dirt and bring in 10 pounds of gold, while recently fired Scott swallows his pride and asks Hank for his old job back.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, locates an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a salvage yard.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Brother and sister team Robbie and Ashleigh hit house removal hell on a mud-bogged mission out of Brisbane. Elsewhere, Nick and Jo battle storms in remote Western Australia.

programme.title: MotoGP
programme.desc: The Grand Prix of Qatar. Action from the opening round of the campaign, held at Losail International Circuit.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz's finest finds and most premium picks in the first series, showcasing the best of their adventures and ultimate restorations.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Staffordshire, modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard gains access to a private collection of a pub owner, who has been hoarding antiques for over half a century.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: Old partners Aaron Grotjahn and Col Duff reunite on a prospecting mission. Meanwhile, the Tunnel Rats race to protect their claim as rival miners close in.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The crew of the Time Bandit celebrates Christmas, but the festivities are interrupted by an unhinged deckhand going on the rampage. Jake Anderson awaits the birth of his baby.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How coloured crayons used by children and artists are created and how artisans and craftsmen make treasured mirrors in India.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex technological processes involved in creating next-generation race-cars that run on electricity. Plus, the creation of mead, favourite drink of the Vikings.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Seana is 23 and nearly 700lbs, living at her mum's house, depressed and anxious. Dr Now can give her the tools she needs to live, but only she can save herself.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The investigation into the murders of two men found beaten to death in a bar. An anonymous letter to a TV station provides a vital lead for detectives involved in the case.

programme.title: Crime Stories
programme.desc: A look at the case of Elizabeth Gatenby, who masterminded the death of her mother's husband, embroiling her son and another teenager in the deadly scheme.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which two young women failed to return home from the local drive-thru. As their parents began a search for them, a fisherman gave police their first clue.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's quest to identify members of terrorist group Omega 7, whose crimes include bombings and assassinations including that of Cuban refugee leader Eulalio Jose Negrin.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: The team looks back on its most memorable rescues. Plus, updates on the progress of some of the animals saved.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Tiffany's choice of a hot pink gown is proving controversial with her mother, while second-time bride Holly attends her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A customer faces a dilemma, and a bride's friends are not sure what to make of her over-the-top dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride looks for a dress that both she and her grandmother are happy with, while another customer wants to pay tribute to her own late grandmother with her gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A Shar Pei dog's excessive folds of skin threaten to damage its eyesight, so Dr Chris Brown performs a nip-tuck operation.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A dog gets hit by a car, pooch Ava eats a G-string, a distressed mother loses her joey and a canine gets hung out of a window upside-down.

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A look at daily life in New York's Bronx Zoo, documenting the routine operations that provide quality care for animals while educating the public on wildlife and conservation.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, an unusual Harley-Davidson motorbike, an antique flapper purse and a pair of solid gold coins keep Dan and his assistant Ellie busy doing high-end deals. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, staff broker a deal on a fur coat and ring, and a 100-year-old music player.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How crime writers research their material, combining the perspectives of police, criminals and journalists to provide detailed accounts of illegal activity.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of interior designer William 'Billy' McGrath, a self-made millionaire, who went missing in August 2009. His body was located two years later, buried under a house, some months after handyman Brad Tocker had been arrested on suspicion of fraud and identification theft.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The story of millionaire Bob Harrod, who finally married his childhood sweetheart Fontelle at the age of 81. While she was making preparations to move from Missouri to join her new husband at his California house in July 2009, he vanished from outside the property, and though his car keys were taken the vehicle itself remained in the drive.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case in which a loving couple were gunned down and killed. A cryptic message found scrawled across the pair's bedroom wall led police to suspect the crime was drug related, though the victims had no obvious involvement in such an illegal trade.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: A customer is prepared to spend a lot of money on her dream gown, while another bride hopes to impress the five friends she has brought to her fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: A bride has expensive tastes but a limited budget, and a customer travels from America to Australia to buy a dress for a wedding in the Bahamas.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.sub-title: It Takes a Village to Buy a Dress
programme.desc: A bride finds dress shopping a more emotional experience than expected, and a customer may have finally made her choice after trying on 60 gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Australia
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Wendi is searching for the perfect gown after not getting to wear one in her first wedding, while Shannon hopes her dress will still fit perfectly.

programme.title: Say Yes: Wedding SOS
programme.desc: With no budget for their wedding, George Kotsiopoulos attempts to glam up a wedding for Kayla and Cody in under five days.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore saves three things from being tipped in Witley, Surrey, that she thinks she can turn a profit from for the people dumping them, one of which is an inspiring old chair.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road in Sheffield, Dan Hatfield and his team try to do a deal on a tank, and one customer wants Â£10,000 for his gold - but can Dan help him reach his target? At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south-east London, boss Nathan Finch is bewitched by some valuable paintings, and wants to do a deal on some stunning earrings that could kick-start a dream business.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Catching up with Nikki, who has continued to lose weight and found her social life and career improving, but who still wishes to have skin removal surgery.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.desc: Dayton goes into surgery after injuring his eyelid in an accident, and Christine's daughter applies for an internship with a fashion designer.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Since her first visit, Rebecca has lost so much weight that her dress no longer fits. Plus, it's an emotional fitting for cancer-survivor Natalie.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Behind the scenes at a wedding dress shop catering to larger customers.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Detectives try to catch a violent rapist who has been attacking women in Denver, Colorado.
